content: Of course, barring fools or knaves commenting, the title of the thread is supported. a small percentage of the SPENDULUS has been obligated, and the economy gets itself into order despte the tiny influence of the SPENDULUS. Just as Morgenthau commented after the fact about the wasteful, ineffective spending of the New Deal. And when the small amount of SPENDULUS that has been obligated so far is compared to the annual value of the US economy, the effect is even more insignificant. The SPENDULUS is a farce, and only dumb, indifferent, or lying people will tout its merits. We heard and read the jackasses tell us that Bush was spending too much and casuing economic difficulties as a result (a rationale to votejackass in '06). The jackass solution is to spending far, far more. This is absurd. Our children and grandchildren are screwed. Coupled with all the other increased power-purchasing and vote-buying, the typical American taxpaying family will be saddled with $100,000 extra in taxes, just to pay off the debt of Obama's planned increases in spending, during their working lives. This is not some assumption; it is a reliable calculation.

content: What got me was the urgency to get the bill past both houses of Congress, there wasn't even time for lawmakers to actually read it. It absolutely had to be passed because we were in the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression. Then, once it did pass both houses, President Obama waited four days to sign it, and wasted the money it took to fly to Denver to sign it.

content: Obama has spent trillions of dollars that can't be accounted for and that haven't done anything to stimulate the economy. It's actually making things worse by substantially increasing our debt, and heading us towards hyper inflation in the coming years. In USA TODAY, they had a front page story that read: "Leap in U.S. debt saddles taxpayers." Taxpayers are on the hook for an extra $55,000 a household to cover rising federal commitments made just in the past year. Is this the change that Americans voted for and support? Well, Americans are not going to have a choice, and those who will be impacted the most, will be the poor. What is hope when there is no hope? Maybe Obama can start passing out potatoes... "The World's Finest"

content: I have three major clients in the PA, DE, and NJ area. These are municipalities and state agencies such as the Department of Transportation. As a result of the stimulus money, I've seen new projects proposed or shelved projects get new life. These include projects such as wastewater treatment plant upgrades, bridge rehabilitation, power grid substations. Now, if you're going to complete these projects the right way, there needs to be field investigations, planning, and design before rolling out massive field crews and paying out contractors to perform the work. This is why when the statement the stimulus doesn't take effect until 2010 is accurate. Why would a Water Treatment Plant "pay out" millions to dollars to private contractors for distribution system upgrades if engineers are still in the design and planning phase? If you're a municipality and you were allocated $100 million to build a new water treatment plant, the federal government will not write you a one time check of $100 million if most that money won't be needed until the project is actually in construction and cranes, excavators, and pump trucks are on the ground.
reply: I have three major clients in the PA, DE, and NJ area. These are municipalities and state agencies such as the Department of Transportation. As a result of the stimulus money, I've seen new projects proposed or shelved projects get new life. These include projects such as wastewater treatment plant upgrades, bridge rehabilitation, power grid substations. Now, if you're going to complete these projects the right way, there needs to be field investigations, planning, and design before rolling out massive field crews and paying out contractors to perform the work. This is why when the statement the stimulus doesn't take effect until 2010 is accurate. Why would a Water Treatment Plant "pay out" millions to dollars to private contractors for distribution system upgrades if engineers are still in the design and planning phase? If you're a municipality and you were allocated $100 million to build a new water treatment plant, the federal government will not write you a one time check of $100 million if most that money won't be needed until the project is actually in construction and cranes, excavators, and pump trucks are on the ground.
title: Obama Administration flat out LYING about Stimulus

content: Of course, barring fools or knaves commenting, the title of the thread is supported. a small percentage of the SPENDULUS has been obligated, and the economy gets itself into order despte the tiny influence of the SPENDULUS. Just as Morgenthau commented after the fact about the wasteful, ineffective spending of the New Deal. And when the small amount of SPENDULUS that has been obligated so far is compared to the annual value of the US economy, the effect is even more insignificant. The SPENDULUS is a farce, and only dumb, indifferent, or lying people will tout its merits. We heard and read the jackasses tell us that Bush was spending too much and casuing economic difficulties as a result (a rationale to votejackass in '06). The jackass solution is to spending far, far more. This is absurd. Our children and grandchildren are screwed. Coupled with all the other increased power-purchasing and vote-buying, the typical American taxpaying family will be saddled with $100,000 extra in taxes, just to pay off the debt of Obama's planned increases in spending, during their working lives. This is not some assumption; it is a reliable calculation.

content: What got me was the urgency to get the bill past both houses of Congress, there wasn't even time for lawmakers to actually read it. It absolutely had to be passed because we were in the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression. Then, once it did pass both houses, President Obama waited four days to sign it, and wasted the money it took to fly to Denver to sign it.

content: Obama has spent trillions of dollars that can't be accounted for and that haven't done anything to stimulate the economy. It's actually making things worse by substantially increasing our debt, and heading us towards hyper inflation in the coming years. In USA TODAY, they had a front page story that read: "Leap in U.S. debt saddles taxpayers." Taxpayers are on the hook for an extra $55,000 a household to cover rising federal commitments made just in the past year. Is this the change that Americans voted for and support? Well, Americans are not going to have a choice, and those who will be impacted the most, will be the poor. What is hope when there is no hope? Maybe Obama can start passing out potatoes... "The World's Finest"

content: I have three major clients in the PA, DE, and NJ area. These are municipalities and state agencies such as the Department of Transportation. As a result of the stimulus money, I've seen new projects proposed or shelved projects get new life. These include projects such as wastewater treatment plant upgrades, bridge rehabilitation, power grid substations. Now, if you're going to complete these projects the right way, there needs to be field investigations, planning, and design before rolling out massive field crews and paying out contractors to perform the work. This is why when the statement the stimulus doesn't take effect until 2010 is accurate. Why would a Water Treatment Plant "pay out" millions to dollars to private contractors for distribution system upgrades if engineers are still in the design and planning phase? If you're a municipality and you were allocated $100 million to build a new water treatment plant, the federal government will not write you a one time check of $100 million if most that money won't be needed until the project is actually in construction and cranes, excavators, and pump trucks are on the ground.
reply: I have three major clients in the PA, DE, and NJ area. These are municipalities and state agencies such as the Department of Transportation. As a result of the stimulus money, I've seen new projects proposed or shelved projects get new life. These include projects such as wastewater treatment plant upgrades, bridge rehabilitation, power grid substations. Now, if you're going to complete these projects the right way, there needs to be field investigations, planning, and design before rolling out massive field crews and paying out contractors to perform the work. This is why when the statement the stimulus doesn't take effect until 2010 is accurate. Why would a Water Treatment Plant "pay out" millions to dollars to private contractors for distribution system upgrades if engineers are still in the design and planning phase? If you're a municipality and you were allocated $100 million to build a new water treatment plant, the federal government will not write you a one time check of $100 million if most that money won't be needed until the project is actually in construction and cranes, excavators, and pump trucks are on the ground.
title: Obama Administration flat out LYING about Stimulus

content: Government is paracitic. When paracites become too numerous or too large, or the host becomes ill, the host dies. Our surrent Obama Administration has become too large and the host is ill. So what is the Obama Administration plan? Take less? NO. Drop off some of the paracites so the host can recover? NO. Get the host good meds so that healing is possible DESPITE the paracites?NO! The Obama Administration plan is the opposite. INCREASE the number of paracites, INCREASE their size, feed the paracites MORE and MORE , while starving the HOST and it's symbiotes (Military, Police, Fire, Medical system) hastening the hosts demise. What rational person could support such a program?

content: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: >>>http://cosmos.bcst.yahoo.com/up/player/popup/?rn=3906861&cl=13717936&ch=4226720&src=news<<< Flat out lies concerning job creation, and how much of the stimulus has been sent out...All of their statements are based on theory not facts. 100 days, and less than 5% of Obamas 800billion dollar give away has been distributed... How quickly could One disburse that kind of money? Let's not get to hasty...give the President a chance... He strikes me as a considerate and thoughtful person... And, although, I disagree some of his methodology/leanings... I will give him elbow room for another 100 days... My guess is...He's just now comprehending the fuller nature of his dilemmas...
